alert.note: Alert for Hancock; McDonough; Warren (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 15 at 6:28PM CDT until April 15 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Hancock County in west central Illinois... Southern Warren County in west central Illinois... Northern McDonough County in west central Illinois... * Until 700 PM CDT. * At 628 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Spring Lake to near Argyle Lake State Park, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Macomb, Western Illinois University and Macomb Municipal Airport around 635 PM CDT. Bardolph and Scottsburg around 640 PM CDT. Sciota around 645 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Bushnell, Good Hope, Walnut Grove, Little Swan Lake, Prairie City Airport, Avon, Prairie City, Youngstown and Swan Creek. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building.
